main event: A round, orange-colored object was observed falling to the ground near Eugene, Oregon in 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a ball of flame emitting black smoke and an orange colored flame, resembling a lighted parachute exiting an airplane.
The object was observed by several people, including control tower operators, who all agreed on the description.
The object drifted towards the west, even though the wind was from the west, and was spotted again later.
No definitive conclusion was reached, but the most likely explanation was that it was flares being discharged from a civilian aircraft.
Another report describes a bright, pulsating orange object that was observed just above the horizon and gradually faded, but was seen again later.
